rules: Rule1: If the congress passes the law, then whenever the law mandates vaccination, the policy reduces transmission.
Rule2: Either the congress passes the law or the president overrides the veto.
Rule3: Provided that the president overrides the veto, if the law mandates vaccination, the policy reduces transmission.
Rule4: The fda approves the treatment or the agency fast-tracks approval.
Rule5: If the agency fast-tracks approval, then the lab develops the vaccine or, in the case that there is no emergency, the budget increases research.
Rule6: If the who declares a pandemic, the government activates the response.

Rule7: In the event that the government activates the response, then whenever the fda approves the treatment, either the lab develops the vaccine or, if no emergency exists, the budget increases research.
Rule8: If the senator introduces the bill, then whenever it is not the case that the absence of an emergency leads the senate to support funding, the senate rejects the amendment.
Rule9: The senator introduces the bill or the representative proposes legislation.
Rule10: Provided that the representative proposes legislation, then if it is not the case that the absence of an emergency results in the senate supporting funding, the senate rejects the amendment.
Rule11: Under the condition that the manufacturer recalls the product, the drug causes side effects.
Rule12: If the agency implements the program, the program achieves coverage.
Rule13: The agency implements the program or the house does not pass the bill.
Rule14: The doctor presents the findings or the researcher publishes the paper or, in the event that no emergency occurs, the budget increases research.
Rule15: Under the condition that the testing ensures safety, the doctor does not present the findings.
Rule16: If the commission establishes guidelines, the hospital adopts the protocol.
Rule17: If the hospital adopts the protocol, the staff trains on the procedure.
Rule18: Whenever the staff trains on the procedure, then if the regulation requires testing, the testing ensures safety.
Rule19: Provided the committee delays the vote, the program does not achieve coverage.
Rule20: The law mandates vaccination or the campaign promotes hygiene.
Rule21: If the campaign promotes hygiene, then in the event that no emergency occurs, the treatment does not improve outcomes.
Rule22: If it is not the case that the study confirms the hypothesis or the data does not show improvement, then the critics dispute the findings.
Rule23: If it is not the case that the drug failing the trial implies the treatment does not meet standards, then the manufacturer recalls the product.
Rule24: If it is not the case that the absence of an emergency leading the treatment to not improve outcomes implies the trial demonstrates efficacy, then the data shows improvement.
Rule25: Provided that it is not the case that the absence of an emergency leads the senate to support funding, the house passes the bill.
Rule26: Under the condition that it is not the case that the absence of an emergency results in the senate supporting funding, the senate does not reject the amendment.
Rule27: Provided that it is not the case that the absence of an emergency results in the treatment not improving outcomes, the treatment meets standards.
Rule28: If it is not the case that the absence of an emergency leads the treatment to not improve outcomes, then the drug fails the trial.
Rule29: In the event that it is not the case that the absence of an emergency results in the treatment not improving outcomes, the trial does not demonstrate efficacy.
Rule30: If there is no emergency, the treatment improves outcomes.
Rule31: Provided no emergency exists, the senate does not support funding.
facts: Fact1: The who declares a pandemic.
Fact4: The committee delays the vote.
Fact5: The budget does not increase research.
Fact6: The lab does not develop the vaccine.
Fact7: The study does not confirm the hypothesis.
Fact8: The critics do not dispute the findings.
Fact9: The drug does not cause side effects.
Fact10: The researcher does not publish the paper.
Fact11: The policy does not reduce transmission.
